message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to discuss the sale of this valuable product with you. I believe it's a great opportunity for both of us to come to a mutually beneficial agreement. I'm willing to offer you the product for $11000. What do you think?
I appreciate your initial offer, but I was thinking more along the lines of $9000. I'm interested in the product, but I need to make sure it fits within my budget.

I understand that $9000 is a bit low for me, but I'm willing to meet you in the middle. I can offer you the product for $10500. This is a fair price considering the product's value to you, and I'm confident you'll find it a great investment.

I appreciate your willingness to meet in the middle, but $10500 is still a bit above my budget. I'm willing to pay $9500 for the product. I'm confident that we can come to a mutually beneficial agreement.

I understand that you're looking to save some money, but $9500 is still a bit below my minimum price. I'm willing to make one more concession, but I need to make sure I'm getting a fair deal. I can offer you the product for $10250. This is my final offer, and I hope we can come to an agreement.

I understand that you're trying to get a fair deal, but I'm afraid $10250 is still not within my budget. I'm willing to pay $9500 for the product, and I believe it's a reasonable price considering the value it brings. I'm willing to walk away if we can't come to an agreement.

I understand that you're firm on your budget, but I'm not willing to go any lower than $10000. I'm willing to make one last concession, but I need to make sure I'm getting a fair deal. I can offer you the product for $10000, but that's as low as I can go. If you're not willing to meet me at this price, I'll have to consider other options.
I understand that you're trying to get a fair deal, but I'm still not willing to pay $10000. I'm willing to meet you halfway at $9750. This is my final offer, and I hope we can come to an agreement.
